Class RegionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • RegionModel

  • public class RegionModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Project #5 CS 2334, Section 10 April 22, 2014 This class houses the data for all types of geographic regions. It contains the methods to work with this data as well as ActionListeners in order to notify any connected views of updates to the data.
    Version:
    1.0

      A Constructor of RegionModel objects

      • readBinaryFile

        public void readBinaryFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads all information from a binary file and stores it within RegionModel as continents, countries, cities, points of interest, and places of interest.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of binary file geographic region information is in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if stream to fileName cannot be written or closed.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if no definition for a specified Class is found.

      • writeBinaryFile

        public void writeBinaryFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Writes the entirety of data contained within the RegionModel (Continents, Countries, etc.) as objects to a binary file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of binary file to be written to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if stream to fileName cannot be written or closed.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if no definition for a specified Class is found.

      • sortCityListByChoice

        public static void sortCityListByChoice(java.lang.String choice,
                        java.util.ArrayList<City> cityList)
        Sorts a list of city objects by the regular search methods as well as methods exclusive to cities such as latitude, longitude, and elevation.
        Parameters:
        choice - String representing user's sorting choice.
        cityList - An ArrayList of Cities to be sorted.

      • generateMultiBarGraph

        public static <E extends EnclosingRegion> void generateMultiBarGraph(java.util.ArrayList<E> regionList,
                                                     java.lang.String sortOption)
        This method displays a bar graph to the screen. The bar graph has multiple bars organized from greatest to least and reflects either the area or population of a list of regions.
        Parameters:
        regionList - List of regions (arranged either by area or population) to be graphed
        sortOption - Specifies how the list of geographic regions is sorted

      • displayStackedBarChartView

        public static <E extends EnclosingRegion> void displayStackedBarChartView(java.util.ArrayList<E> regionList,
                                                          int searchOption)
        This method displays a graph composed of a single bar. The bar is divided into smaller segments based on the areas of geographic regions contained in a list. The area of the geographic region is shown to the left, the name to the right.
        Parameters:
        regionList - List of geographic regions to be graphed.
        searchOption - Specifies what type of information the geographic region list contains.

      • displayMapView

        public static void displayMapView(java.util.ArrayList<City> cityList)
        This method takes an array of cities then plots it on a plate caree map. The map is displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        cityList - List of cities to be plotted
